verses.kjv: Hearken to me, ye that follow after righteousness, ye that seek the LORD: look unto the rock whence ye are hewn, and to the hole of the pit whence ye are digged.
verses.web: “Listen to me, you who follow after righteousness, you who seek LORD. Look to the rock you were cut from, and to the quarry you were dug from.
verses.ct: "Listen to me, all of you who pursue righteousness and seek the LORD. Think about the rock you were cut from, the quarry where you were carved out.

verses.kjv: Look unto Abraham your father, and unto Sarah that bare you: for I called him alone, and blessed him, and increased him.
verses.web: Look to Abraham your father, and to Sarah who bore you; for when he was but one I called him, I blessed him, and made him many.
verses.ct: Look back to Abraham, your father, and to Sarah, who gave birth to you. When I called him, he was just one man — but I blessed him and made his descendants into a great multitude.

verses.kjv: For the LORD shall comfort Zion: he will comfort all her waste places; and he will make her wilderness like Eden, and her desert like the garden of the LORD; joy and gladness shall be found therein, thanksgiving, and the voice of melody.
verses.web: For LORD has comforted Zion. He has comforted all her waste places, and has made her wilderness like Eden, and her desert like the garden of LORD. Joy and gladness will be found in them, thanksgiving, and the voice of melody.
verses.ct: The LORD will comfort Zion. He will comfort all her ruined places, turning her wilderness into Eden and her desert into the garden of the LORD. Joy and gladness will fill her — thanksgiving and the sound of singing.

verses.kjv: Hearken unto me, my people; and give ear unto me, O my nation: for a law shall proceed from me, and I will make my judgment to rest for a light of the people.
verses.web: “Listen to me, my people; and hear me, my nation, for a law will go out from me, and I will establish my justice for a light to the peoples.
verses.ct: "Pay attention to me, my people; listen closely, my nation. A law will go out from me, and I will establish my justice as a light for all peoples.

verses.kjv: My righteousness is near; my salvation is gone forth, and mine arms shall judge the people; the isles shall wait upon me, and on mine arm shall they trust.
verses.web: My righteousness is near. My salvation has gone out, and my arms will judge the peoples. The islands will wait for me, and they will trust my arm.
verses.ct: My righteousness is close at hand. My salvation has already gone out, and my arms will bring justice to the nations. The distant coastlands are waiting for me — they will put their trust in my power.

verses.kjv: Lift up your eyes to the heavens, and look upon the earth beneath: for the heavens shall vanish away like smoke, and the earth shall wax old like a garment, and they that dwell therein shall die in like manner: but my salvation shall be for ever, and my righteousness shall not be abolished.
verses.web: Lift up your eyes to the heavens, and look at the earth beneath; for the heavens will vanish away like smoke, and the earth will wear out like a garment. Its inhabitants will die in the same way, but my salvation will be forever, and my righteousness will not be abolished.
verses.ct: Look up at the heavens and look down at the earth beneath. The heavens will vanish like smoke, and the earth will wear out like old clothing. Everyone living on it will die in the same way. But my salvation will last forever, and my righteousness will never be undone.

verses.kjv: Hearken unto me, ye that know righteousness, the people in whose heart is my law; fear ye not the reproach of men, neither be ye afraid of their revilings.
verses.web: “Listen to me, you who know righteousness, the people in whose heart is my law. Don’t fear the reproach of men, and don’t be dismayed at their insults.
verses.ct: "Listen to me, you who know what is right — you people who carry my law in your hearts. Don't fear the insults of others, and don't be shaken by their mockery.

verses.kjv: For the moth shall eat them up like a garment, and the worm shall eat them like wool: but my righteousness shall be for ever, and my salvation from generation to generation.
verses.web: For the moth will eat them up like a garment, and the worm will eat them like wool; but my righteousness will be forever, and my salvation to all generations.”
verses.ct: Moths will eat them up like a garment, and worms will devour them like wool. But my righteousness will last forever, and my salvation will endure through every generation."

verses.kjv: Awake, awake, put on strength, O arm of the LORD; awake, as in the ancient days, in the generations of old. Art thou not it that hath cut Rahab, and wounded the dragon?
verses.web: Awake, awake, put on strength, arm of LORD! Awake, as in the days of old, the generations of ancient times. Isn’t it you who cut Rahab in pieces, who pierced the monster?
verses.ct: Wake up, wake up! Clothe yourself in strength, O arm of the LORD! Rise up as you did in ancient days, in generations long past. Wasn't it you who cut Rahab to pieces and pierced the great sea monster?

verses.kjv: Art thou not it which hath dried the sea, the waters of the great deep; that hath made the depths of the sea a way for the ransomed to pass over?
verses.web: Isn’t it you who dried up the sea, the waters of the great deep; who made the depths of the sea a way for the redeemed to pass over?
verses.ct: Wasn't it you who dried up the sea — the waters of the great deep — and turned the ocean floor into a road for the redeemed to cross over?

verses.kjv: Therefore the redeemed of the LORD shall return, and come with singing unto Zion; and everlasting joy shall be upon their head: they shall obtain gladness and joy; and sorrow and mourning shall flee away.
verses.web: Those ransomed by LORD will return, and come with singing to Zion. Everlasting joy shall be on their heads. They will obtain gladness and joy. Sorrow and sighing shall flee away.
verses.ct: Those the LORD has ransomed will return. They will come into Zion singing, crowned with everlasting joy. Gladness and delight will overtake them, and sorrow and grief will disappear.

verses.kjv: I, even I, am he that comforteth you: who art thou, that thou shouldest be afraid of a man that shall die, and of the son of man which shall be made as grass;
verses.web: “I, even I, am he who comforts you. Who are you, that you are afraid of man who shall die, and of the son of man who will be made as grass?
verses.ct: "I — I myself — am the one who comforts you. So why are you afraid of mere humans who will die, of mortals who wither like grass?

verses.kjv: And forgettest the LORD thy maker, that hath stretched forth the heavens, and laid the foundations of the earth; and hast feared continually every day because of the fury of the oppressor, as if he were ready to destroy? and where is the fury of the oppressor?
verses.web: Have you forgotten LORD your Maker, who stretched out the heavens, and laid the foundations of the earth? Do you live in fear continually all day because of the fury of the oppressor, when he prepares to destroy? Where is the fury of the oppressor?
verses.ct: Have you forgotten the LORD, your Maker, who stretched out the heavens and laid the foundations of the earth? You live in constant terror every day because of the fury of your oppressor, as though he were about to destroy you. But where is that oppressor's fury now?

verses.kjv: The captive exile hasteneth that he may be loosed, and that he should not die in the pit, nor that his bread should fail.
verses.web: The captive exile will speedily be freed. He will not die and go down into the pit. His bread won’t fail.
verses.ct: The prisoner in chains will soon be set free. He will not die in the dungeon, and he will not go hungry.

verses.kjv: But I am the LORD thy God, that divided the sea, whose waves roared: The LORD of hosts is his name.
verses.web: For I am LORD your God, who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar. LORD of Armies is his name.
verses.ct: I am the LORD your God, who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar. The LORD of hosts is his name.

verses.kjv: And I have put my words in thy mouth, and I have covered thee in the shadow of mine hand, that I may plant the heavens, and lay the foundations of the earth, and say unto Zion, Thou art my people.
verses.web: I have put my words in your mouth and have covered you in the shadow of my hand, that I may plant the heavens, and lay the foundations of the earth, and tell Zion, ‘You are my people.’ ”
verses.ct: I have placed my words in your mouth and sheltered you in the shadow of my hand — so that I might stretch out the heavens, lay the foundations of the earth, and say to Zion, 'You are my people.'"

verses.kjv: Awake, awake, stand up, O Jerusalem, which hast drunk at the hand of the LORD the cup of his fury; thou hast drunken the dregs of the cup of trembling, and wrung them out.
verses.web: Awake, awake! Stand up, Jerusalem, you who have drunk from LORD’s hand the cup of his wrath. You have drunken the bowl of the cup of staggering, and drained it.
verses.ct: Wake up, wake up! Get on your feet, Jerusalem! You drank the cup of the LORD's fury straight from his hand. You drained that staggering cup down to the very last drop.

verses.kjv: There is none to guide her among all the sons whom she hath brought forth; neither is there any that taketh her by the hand of all the sons that she hath brought up.
verses.web: There is no one to guide her among all the sons to whom she has given birth; and there is no one who takes her by the hand among all the sons who she has brought up.
verses.ct: Out of all the children she raised, not one is left to guide her. Out of all the sons she brought up, not one takes her by the hand.

verses.kjv: These two things are come unto thee; who shall be sorry for thee? desolation, and destruction, and the famine, and the sword: by whom shall I comfort thee?
verses.web: These two things have happened to you— who will grieve with you?— desolation and destruction, and famine and the sword. How can I comfort you?
verses.ct: Two disasters have struck you — and who will grieve with you? Ruin and destruction, famine and the sword. Who is left to comfort you?

verses.kjv: Thy sons have fainted, they lie at the head of all the streets, as a wild bull in a net: they are full of the fury of the LORD, the rebuke of thy God.
verses.web: Your sons have fainted. They lie at the head of all the streets, like an antelope in a net. They are full of LORD’s wrath, the rebuke of your God.
verses.ct: Your sons have collapsed. They lie helpless at every street corner, like a wild animal caught in a net — overwhelmed by the LORD's wrath, crushed by the rebuke of your God.

verses.kjv: Therefore hear now this, thou afflicted, and drunken, but not with wine:
verses.web: Therefore now hear this, you afflicted, and drunken, but not with wine:
verses.ct: So listen to this, you who are suffering — you who stagger, but not from wine:

verses.kjv: Thus saith thy Lord the LORD, and thy God that pleadeth the cause of his people, Behold, I have taken out of thine hand the cup of trembling, even the dregs of the cup of my fury; thou shalt no more drink it again:
verses.web: Your Lord LORD, your God who pleads the cause of his people, says, “Behold, I have taken out of your hand the cup of staggering, even the bowl of the cup of my wrath. You will not drink it any more.
verses.ct: This is what your Lord, the LORD, your God who fights for his people, says: "Look — I have taken the staggering cup out of your hand, that bowl filled with my fury. You will never have to drink from it again.

verses.kjv: But I will put it into the hand of them that afflict thee; which have said to thy soul, Bow down, that we may go over: and thou hast laid thy body as the ground, and as the street, to them that went over.
verses.web: I will put it into the hand of those who afflict you, who have said to your soul, ‘Bow down, that we may walk over you;’ and you have laid your back as the ground, like a street to those who walk over.”
verses.ct: Instead, I will hand it to those who tormented you — the ones who told you, 'Lie down on the ground so we can walk over you.' And you laid your back flat like a street for them to trample on."
